context: The Estonian verb 'asume' has several main meanings: 1) to be located or situated somewhere (for places, objects, people), 2) to go to or arrive at a place and settle there, 3) to start/begin doing some activity. It can indicate physical location ('Maja asub järve ääres'), temporary or permanent residence ('Ta asus aastaid välismaal'), or the commencement of an action ('Asuti niitma'). The verb changes form depending on context - 'asun', 'asud', 'asub', 'asume' etc.
